result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Philip Jay Newsom was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

Court FINDS that the involuntary administration of psychotropic medications is needed and DHS is authorized to administer psychotropic medication or treatment to the defendant.

Waiver of Jury Trial, filed.
filed.

Parties stipulate to the findings of the doctor's report. Trial proceeded. Sworn for the defense: Dr. Robert Rawski, MD. Exhibit 1 received. Testimony closed. Court finds that the defendant not guilty by reason of insanity and ordered the defendant remanded to the custody of DHFS. Court ordered the defendant committed to Mendota Mental Health Institute for up to 7.5 years. Order signed and filed.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of no contest.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

Defendant Philip Jay Newsom in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Philip Jay Newsom in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the state, court ordered the use of a dangerous weapon enhancer dismissed.

Attorney J. Dennis Thornton in court, defendant Philip Jay Newsom not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for Nicolas Heitman for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is at Mendota Mental Health Institute and not produced.  Counsels have reviewed the report of Dr. Phelps as to defendant's competency.  There are no challenges that the defendant is competent to proceed. Atty Thornton will review with defendant and the court will defer its finding until the next date when defendant is present.  Matter is set for PHASE 2 NGI court trial on 10-14-2015 at 10:30.
Clerk confirmed with Dr. Rawski that he is available for testimony.  State to complete OTP for defendant.
Report dated 9-23-2015 from Dr. Mark Phelps, MD (Mendota Mental Health) received via FAX

Attorney J. Dennis Thornton in court, defendant Philip Jay Newsom not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Video conference for the defendant arranged for the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Philip Jay Newsom in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Philip Jay Newsom in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Available discovery was provided to defense counsel.  Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed.   Defense counsel entered a plea not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect on behalf of the client. Court ordered defendant to be examined at Mendota Mental Health by Dr. Rawski of the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Order For Examination under 971.16, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit.  Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 4 on 6-30-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld

filed.

Signature bond remains in place as long as defendant is residing at Mendota Health Institute.  Upon the release of defendant from Mendota Health Insitution, signature bond converts to a cash bond in the amount of $20,000.00.    mld

Defendant Philip Jay Newsom in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton. Defendant Philip Jay Newsom in custody.  Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 4 on 5-15-2015 at 1:30 pm.  mld

Defendant Philip Jay Newsom in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Philip Jay Newsom in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Report of Dr Lesley Baird, Mendota Mental Health Institute, dated 4-24-2015, received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings. Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Court ordered that the cash bond in the amount of $20,000.00 is converted to a signature bond in the amount of $20,000.00, as long as defendant is residing at Mendota Mental Health Institution.  If defendant is released from Mendota Mental Institution, signature bond converts to a cash bond in the amount of $20,000.00.

Fax from WCS Assistant Court Liason, Vicki Shequen, to advise that the currently Doctor's Report Return date of 6-18-2015, is outside the statutory timefram of fourteen days to hold a competency hearing on report.   mld
from Dr. Lesley Baird, Licensed Psychologist, Mendota Mental Health Institute, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Philip Jay Newsom in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Philip Jay Newsom in custody.  Evan K Glaberson appeared for Nicolas Heitman for the State of Wisconsin.    
All parties review the doctor's report dated 3-4-2015.  Sworn for the State: Dr. Robert Rawski.  Statement made by defendant.  The Court received the physicians report dated 3-4-2015 for the purposes of this hearing.  Evidence closed.    
The Court found defendant NOT COMPETENT, BUT LIKELY TO REGAIN COMPETENCY with treatment and does lack the capacity to understand Court proceedings.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.  The Court further found that the defendant is not competent to refuse medication for the mental condition.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Order of Commitment (form CR206) signed and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report on 6-18-2015 at 8:30 am, Branch 4.   mld
from Wisconsin Forensic Unit, Robert Rawski M.D., dated 3-4-2014, received and filed.  mld
